title: Bi-Weekly Gaming Discussion Thread
selftext:
What are you playing, r/India? Let us use this thread to discuss any games you're playing, have played or are going to play. (Mobile and board games included!)

What game are you looking forward to? Are you a developer? Show us your wares!

Please don't just list the names of games, make sure to write a word or two about them as well.

Check out r/IndianGaming! They are an active community and also host a few co-op sessions.

**Gaming Thread is posted every two weeks on Tuesday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Bi-Weekly+Gaming+Discussion+Thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/xagdqefyv8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=f975f1c3093a3d9598a1da39854b03d1250bd55d
comments:
Well I just completed HFW and that was an absolute 10/10 incredible game, I did expect the San Francisco section to be bigger the way they were doing marketing, that was disappointing when  it ended up being a small part of the map but other than that, phenomenal game

Haven‚Äôt decided yet which game to do next

Fellas I need some assistance. Which laptop do I get? 

Legion 5 Pro - Ryzen 7 5800H - 3060 6GB - 138k

Legion 5i Pro - i7 11800H - 3060 6GB - 151k

Thing about Intel version is that it has thunderbolt and better pcie 4.0 support and better single core perf. But has heating issues and worse battery life. AMD performs about the same but without both these advantages and disadvantages. 

So is the 13k investment really worth it for the intel version? 

Keep in mind I have a tight budget and upgrading from a Nitro Spin after 5 years. And I'd like to use this for the same amount of time if possible.

Unless you absolutely want to use a high resolution external display, TB4 just doesn‚Äôt justify the price bump. Same with pcie gen 4. The last time I checked there wasn‚Äôt any real life improvement from pcie gen 4 unless you are using some crazy fast ssd which can utilise it, because the graphics card have no use for them.

Intel doesn‚Äôt make sense unless you have very specific creative workload. If it‚Äôs just for gaming go for the Ryzen one

I am 100% planning to use a high resolution external display, because I've already invested in one. So should I just bite the bullet and get the intel version then?

Or just get AMD and go with HDMI.
Legion 5 pro has hdmi 2.1 so you get support for 4K 120hz or 8k 60hz. Can‚Äôt say about multiple monitors

Ah then that should be fine. Legion 5 Pro it is.

Appreciate the help my friend.
Happy to contribute and happy gaming :)
Doing a second playthrough of The Last of Us Part II. Still amazed at how ridiculously good this game looks.
Check if the BIOS of the 5i Pro supports undervolting. If so, you can get good thermals. I have an i7 10th gen and 3060. Max 80C after undervolting
Borderlands 3! It's an OLD title, but I'm playing it for the first time. Liking it so far
If Borderlands 3 is old what is Borderlands 2 and 1? archaic and stone age?

Hey can you tell me where to start learning about computer specs and what they do. I feel like a noob. I never owned a good pc before and probably wont for some time but still wont hurt to know and understand the details

Playing Arkham Asylum and its amazing. 

Riddlers challenges are annoying. I guess this is part of the fun. You feel like Batman .

Wait this is 2019. Nvm not old lol. 

Have you played it? Should I be playing 1 and 2 first?
No. They are amazing looter shooters. You don't need to play them in a sequence.
Destiny 2.
Doing a Dark Soul 3 let play if you want to watch here is the link: https://youtu.be/VYtwQVI\_DbE
Valorant all day everyday with my mates
Where is it played? Is it a desktop game?
It was a best game of 2009üëç
You guys should really play Outerwilds. It's so great. One of the best games I've ever played.
Well i have a new laptop with ryzen 3 processor in it. Can i play valorant in it?? If so then from where can i download it and how much data do i need

+1 
its really one of the best game ever made
Did u finish the dlc EOTE? It's also pretty good. Also, any game recommendations for me?
I did finish the DLC, it was also perfect, but after this game, there‚Äôs a void in my life, other games don‚Äôt hit as good no more
By the way, what other games did you like which are kinda similar to OuterWilds
Elden Ring second playthrough going strong
You are not ready for the internet if you ask people instead of Google.
FPS game by riot to mimic or compete with CSGO but free.
Intel any day. If there is not a huge difference between 3060 ti vs 3060 I'd go for 3060 ti.
I reinstalled battlefield 1 and it's quite enjoyable. The graphics and atmosphere is on point.

I'm currently playing Hollowknight. It's really good. I haven't actually played anything that gave me a similar experience like Outerwilds!
Everyone says Subnautica and Obradinn are kinda similar. So I'm planning to play them next.
Fortnite,  don't downvote me
Completed gta 5 three times then deleted it thinking now I'll not get the urge to play this again.... Guess who's playing the game again for the fourth time....
Fortnite
I'll upvote you for playing fortnite üëç
Elden ring, AC unity.

I‚Äôve completed Elden Ring play#1. I‚Äôve hit L200 just to face Malenia and got my ass handed. Did summons and lived to tell the tale. That didnt feel good. So, on playthrough 2, I‚Äômma go at her again.

You can start with watching how to build a pc videos on YouTube. There are quite a few channels with very good content. 

Some of my favourite channels are Jayzteocents, Gamers nexus, Bitwit and Linus Tech Tips. They do everything from pc build videos, part reviews, comparisons, explaining what different things do etc etc. On the Indian side, the Indian Budget Gamer has some good build videos. 

On written content, [Computer Hope](https://www.computerhope.com) is hands down the best website to learn things for a beginner. [Notebookcheck](https://www.notebookcheck.net) has very very detailed laptop reviews. 

Finally the thing that helped me the most was just reading motherboard manuals xD. A mix of all these should give you a pretty good idea of how computers works, how to read and interpret specs and most importantly that specs alone don‚Äôt convey the whole story. Moreover the PC gaming community is very welcoming, so in case you ever get stuck somewhere or need any help, just get in touch with anyone :)

hello

i want a debit card that makes payments easier for steam, Netflix, Spotify etc. 

what bank has the best offers?

whattttttt how do you not know about valorant its a 5v5 tactical shooter by riot its free and a pc game   
[https://playvalorant.com/en-us/](https://playvalorant.com/en-us/)  


https://www.twitch.tv/directory/game/VALORANT
Am doing Nightmare Run of the Dragon Age series. Gonna do final battle from inquisition.
Thanks! Thanks . THANKS!
Can you tell me too when you get an answer?

You could play GTA4 . Or any of them with mods.

I have been playing PSP GTA games and they are neat. LCS,VCS and Chinatown Wars. All the GTA nostalgia rushes back in
made a post, which isn't there anymore. But I learned my bank should offer international debit cards. Kotak , HDFC etc. has good offers. Or I can use a virtual debit card.
